awards.description:
Royal Philips was awarded the Hendrik Lorentz Award for its pioneering role in the digital transformation of healthcare by applying data science and artificial intelligence (AI).
One of the AI-driven innovations which was awarded by the jury had been developed in the sleep solutions research program: The SmartSleep DeepSleep Headband, which applies deep learning to classifying sleep staging based on EEG data and providing auditory stimulation to the wearer to boost deep sleep.

profile_positions.description:
I am leading and managing the global sleep & respiratory care research programs within Philips Innovation & Strategy. In these programs we are creating AI-enabled new-to-the-world high-tech innovations for sleep diagnostics and treatment and for respiratory care for a ~$2B global business.

In this role I am:
. Leading multi-national teams of over 60 researchers, data scientists, and engineers in a global matrix organization.
. Defining the innovation strategy, vision, and roadmap of the global research programs for Philips sleep & respiratory care solutions.
. Co-creating innovation priorities and roadmaps with large, complex networks of stakeholders, incl. senior management.
. Translating Philips business strategies into short-, medium, and long-term innovation topics and driving the execution of these topics by 6 Scrum Teams in a Scaled Agile execution framework.
. Defining and managing the program backlog on epic-level as Chief Product Owner / Product Manager for 2 Agile Release Trains 
. Acquiring budgets from business, corporate, and external sources - managing AOP and cost plans.
. Doing Key Account Management between corporate Research and the Philips Sleep & Respiratory Care business units.
. Driving improvement initiatives for innovation processes (e.g. innovation portfolio alignment, end-to-end R&D processes). I spearheaded the use of Agile methods for non-software projects within Research.

Innovations from my programs have been recognized with prestigious scientific and business awards:
. In 2019, Philips was awarded the Dutch Hendrik Lorentz Award for our pioneering role in the digital transformation of healthcare by applying data science and artificial intelligence (AI). 
. In 2021, Philips received the CES Innovation Award from the Consumer Technology Association for the Philips Mask Selector, the first and only clinically validated 3D facial scanning solution for sleep patients.

profile_positions.description:
e/MTIC, the Eindhoven MedTech Innovation Center, is a large-scale strategic research collaboration between Philips, TU Eindhoven, Catharina Hospital, Maxima Medical Center, and Kempenhaeghe Epilepsy and Sleep Center.
The partnership, founded in 2018, has a proven scientific and valorization track record and currently includes more than 100 PhD candidates.

I am leading the Daily Management Team of the e/MTIC Sleep Innovation Program. In this role I am co-creating with our academic and clinical partners the research vision and roadmap and I co-coordinate the execution of the scientific sleep innovation program.
As Philips representative in the Sleep DMT it is my responsibility that the e/MTIC sleep research program is optimally aligned with the strategic innovation objectives of Philips.

In the growing e/MTIC sleep research ecosystem we have created a fast track in research, development and implementation of sustainable AI-driven sleep innovations. 
The program has executed approx. 20 scientific PhD projects which led to more than 80 peer-reviewed scientific papers, several patent applications and technology transfers.

Together with my e/MTIC partners I am scouting and pursuing national and international subsidy funding opportunities.
From 2016-2019, I have created the proposal and coordinated the execution of the HealthBed project, a European subsidy project funded by EIT Health, in which we developed unobtrusive contactless sleep monitoring technologies. In this collaboration project we created a unique high-tech research bedroom in which overnight data from 100 healthy subjects was collected to develop and test contactless sleep monitoring technology and AI algorithms.

One of our key collaboration initiatives in e/MTIC, the SOMNIA data collection project, has been named at the International 2021 Sleep Disruptors Conference of the American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM) as highly innovative, best-in-class approach for accelerating sleep technology innovation.

. Creating transparency and alignment on ART status by setting up, coordinating and facilitating agile rituals like Program Increment Review & Plannings events in a global working environment with more than 80 team members and stakeholders spread over organizational units and time-zones (USA, NL, China).

Additionally, in my role as Principal Scientist, I

Furthermore I
. Led ad-interim the research department Personal Health.
